file_content.text: Can't believe all the new ships out there. Maybe it was time I moved on.
Your supplies, Captain. And a little something from the Corvani.
Piece of the hull, nice. Doesn't look too damaged, either. She was always a tough old girl.
Supplies are intact, too. You do good work. Any chance you're looking for a freelance gig?
The Balmorrans could use a good pilot.
No, but you should.
You kidding? Too dangerous. My new ship's going in a hangar.
Just credits for me.
Right. Your share, as promised. There go my nerf leather seats.
Get some perspective.
Hey, I'll be rooting for the locals! From the safety of my new ship.
Guess it's time to start shopping. Find a new name. The Corvana. The Corvanis?
You find anything yet? I'm not the only one depending on those supplies.
Wait. Squad like you must be headed for the field. Got a casualty out there.
This maybe isn't your usual department, Master Jedi, but I could sure use you.
Major. I've been laughed at by every officer here, but blast it, I need help.
Saw the rig you flew in on, Captain. She's nice. Maybe you'll understand.
Ari Skyff, captain of the Corvani. Or I was, until the Imperials got her in their sights. Three hits and we were down.
Beautiful NX-1200. The pilot's chair was all worn in, I had the thrusters calibrated just how I like 'em....
Why attack you?
A ship's everything to a good pilot.
You sound upset.
We were partners, me and the Corvani. I've spent my whole life on that ship.
It's a miracle you made it out alive.
But you survived.
Yeah, real miracle I got to watch the Corvani burn. See the twisted hull and all.
This is a dangerous area for a joyride.
Risky travel, here.
Do I look like a tour guide? I'm doing my part to push the Empire off this rock.
With the laser cannons and the glass cockpit?
That's a nice ride.
And the fifteen-cylinder hyperdrive with overload protection. That was my baby.
It's just a ship.
You married? Well, I was. To the Corvani. For fifteen years.
We were hauling supplies for the resistance. When the Corvani went down, she took the cargo with her.
Weapons, medpacs, energy shields--it's all scattered across the wilds now, inside Imperial territory.
Bad for the resistance.
They're pretty desperate. Even let me name my own price. And I went high.
Have you tried to recover the cargo?
Did anything survive?
Those are Imperial troops out there! I'm good in a scrap, but I'm no soldier.
Wah, wah, wah....
I want that cargo. I need a hire who can take on the Empire's best to get it.
I lost my ship and my livelihood. The payoff for those supplies is my only way off this rock.
You bring back 'em back whole, locals get their goods, I get my creds. Even cut you a share.
The resistance needs everything it can get.
For Balmorra, not you.
Nothing better than helping a good cause. We'll be heroes. Rich heroes.
In that case....
The old girl went down a few kilometers out, in the wilds. Just follow the trail of debris.
Say, when you find the Corvani... bring back a piece of her. Something I can hold onto.
You're a cad. [Refuse quest]
So it's like that. Hope you realize you're stiffing the resistance here, too.
Can't you tell when a man's in mourning? Scram!
Weapons, medpacs, energy shields-- every crate into Imperial territory. And the Imperials picked it up.
The old girl went down a few kilometers out. Imps were still nearby, last I checked. Parasites.
